solution_line_template: Hayden gave {num_rides} groups rides, so he is owed {num_rides} * {pay_per_ride} = $<<{num_rides}*{pay_per_ride}={ride_pay}>>{ride_pay}.
He drove for {hours_worked} hours, so he is owed {hourly_wage} * {hours_worked} = $<<{hourly_wage}*{hours_worked}={wage_pay}>>{wage_pay}.
He refilled the gas tank, so he is owed back {gallons} * {price_per_gallon} = $<<{gallons}*{price_per_gallon}={gas_reimbursement}>>{gas_reimbursement}.
He got two good reviews for a bonus of {num_good_reviews} * {bonus_per_review} = $<<{num_good_reviews}*{bonus_per_review}={review_bonus}>>{review_bonus}.
Hayden is owned {ride_pay} + {wage_pay} + {gas_reimbursement} + {review_bonus} = $<<{ride_pay}+{wage_pay}+{gas_reimbursement}+{review_bonus}={total_owed}>>{total_owed} for his work today.
